items.title: Market falls for sixth week in a row amid tariff concerns, FII sell-off
items.description: The Indian rupee extended the losses in the fifth straight week, despite positive start of the week. The INR declined 14 paise to end at 87.66 per dollar on August 8 against the August 1 closing of 87.52. During the week the rupee touched a low of 87.89 and high of 86.24.

items.title: OTM butterfly for slow market: Shubham Agarwal
items.description: Butterfly is a strategy that involves selling of 2 options close to the current market price of the stock or index and buying a higher strike price option and buying a lower strike price option.

items.title: More than 40 small-cap stocks drop 10-24% amid tariff concerns
items.description: The BSE Small-cap index slipped nearly 2 percent with PG Electroplast, Kitex Garments, Unichem Laboratories, Morepen Laboratories, Advait Energy Transitions, KR Rail Engineering, Faze Three, Advanced Enzyme Technologies falling between 15-24 percent.

items.title: Bulk deals: Promoter entity Indian Continent Investment sells shares worth Rs 11,227 crore in Bharti Airtel
items.description: Indian Continent Investment, in particular, held 2.47 percent stake in Bharti Airtel, and the total promoters shareholding was 51.25 percent as of June 2025.

items.title: Tata Motors sees ICE margins under strain, bets on cost cuts and festive demand for recovery
items.description: Tata Motors share price: In contrast, the company said EV margins have been rising year-on-year even without battery localisation incentives, helped by significant cost cuts.

items.title: Tata Motors races to secure rare earth magnet supply amid global risks
items.description: Tata Motors share price: Domestically, the company said it is covered for the next 2-3 months and it is looking at alternatives outside of China.

items.title: Business in the Week Ahead (August 11- 15, 2025)
items.description: In the coming week India, the US and the UK will release their GDP numbers. As the Trump administration’s arbitrary tariffs push the global economy into deeper turmoil, here’s what investors can expect

items.title: Taking Stock: Bears back in action; Nifty breaks 24,400 first time since May 7
items.description: For the week, BSE Sensex and Nifty down nearly a percent each. Both indices were down for 6th week in a row, the longest losing streak in 5 years.

items.title: Divis Laboratories shares decline 3.45% amid high volume; stock among top losers on Nifty Next 50
items.description: The stock's last traded price was Rs 5,920.00, a 3.45% decline from its previous close, driven by high volume.

items.title: Gainers & Losers: Top 10 stocks that moved the most on August 8
items.description: At close, the Sensex was down 765.47 points or 0.95 percent at 79,857.79, and the Nifty was down 232.85 points or 0.95 percent at 24,363.30. About 1494 shares advanced, 2384 shares declined, and 133 shares unchanged.

items.title: Live: Nifty declines for the 6th week in a row amid Trump's double tariff salvo | Closing Bell
items.description: Nifty Stretches Losing Run To Sixth Week. Nifty Slips Below 24,450; Sensex Down 600 Pts. All Sectors Nosedive Into Red; India Vix Up 1%. Broader Markets Underperform Markets. Nifty Psu Bank, Auto Top Performers This Week. Nifty Realty, Fmcg Worst Hit Sectors This Week. Nifty 50 Gainers: Titan, Ntpc, Dr Reddy's. Nifty 50 Losers: Adani Ent, Airtel, Shriram Finance. Catch Lovisha Darad in conversation with Milan Vaishnav, Founder and Technical Analyst, ChartWizard FZE.
